metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7806 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when the layer manager is freed too early when rendering specific SVG content, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 55.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs38 contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
